greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest prime divisor of A138957(n).
comment: For smallest prime divisors see A138960.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..60
mathematica: a = {}; b = {}; Do[w = RealDigits[n]; w = First[w]; Do[AppendTo[a, w[[Length[w] - k + 1]]], {k, 1, Length[w]}]; p = FromDigits[a]; AppendTo[b, First[Last[FactorInteger[p]]]], {n, 1, 18}]; b
results.author: _Artur Jasinski_, Apr 04 2008
